Dispute_Type: Dispute over payment and usage rights of a redesigned website's computer program
Legal_Issue: Did the respondent infringe the applicant's copyright by reproducing and modifying the computer program?
Credibility_Factor: Implied license inferred from contractual relationship
Legal_Rule: Copyright infringement occurs when someone reproduces or modifies a work without the owner's consent. Implied license may exist if work was created for specific use.
Standard_of_Review: Objective interpretation of contract and implied license
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unauthorized reproduction and modification of computer program
Key_Evidence_Considered: Contract between parties, expert testimony, nature of modifications made
Legal_Framework: Copyright law and contract law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Proving lack of authorization for modification and use
Legal_Provision: Reproduction and modification rights under Copyright Act
Authority: Statutory law (Copyright Act) and common law on implied licenses
Legal_Provision_Cited: Copyright Act provisions on infringement and ownership
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized use and modification of software
Governing_Rule: Existence of implied license negates infringement
